meanings.definition: A person who alienates or estranges others.
meanings.sent1: The alienators in the group made everyone feel left out.
meanings.sent2: The alienators at school always spread rumors to create divisions.
meanings.sent3: The alienators unintentionally turned the party into a quiet gathering.
meanings.sent4: The alienators were like magnets pushing people away.
meanings.sent5: The alienators were like invisible walls separating friends.

meanings.definition: Those who cause others to become hostile or indifferent.
meanings.sent1: The alienators in the office created tension among colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The alienators in the neighborhood always stirred up trouble.
meanings.sent3: The alienators made the situation awkward with their comments.
meanings.sent4: The alienators were like troublemakers sparking conflicts.
meanings.sent5: The alienators were like cold winds chilling relationships.
